fields.value: Daily Operation of the United States Senate, 1975

authorName.value: Commission on the Operation of the Senate

authorAffiliation.value: Commission on the Operation of the Senate

dsDescriptionValue.value: This data collection contains descriptions of legislative  activity in the United States Senate during the First Session of the  Ninety-fourth Congress (1975). The four data files were obtained from  the Government Division of the Congressional Research Service of the  Library of Congress. Part 1 contains information on bills and  resolutions considered, including the type of measure, the date  and number of subcommittee hearings about it, and the actions taken on  it. Part 2 describes committee activities, including detailed  information about every committee meeting held, e.g., dates and times,  open or closed, purpose(s) of meeting, subject area covered, and  number and type of witnesses appearing before each. Part 3 contains  information about the Senate floor sessions, including times of  convening and adjourning and number of record and quorum votes  taken. Part 4 contains records of the committee and subcommittee  assignments of all Senators and the factors influencing those  assignments, e.g., each Senator's Senate leadership position, state  seniority, Senate seniority in years, party affiliation, party  seniority in years, state population in the thousands, prior occupation, and former public office held.

topicClassValue.value: ICPSR XIII.B. Legislative and Deliberative Bodies, Studies of Decision-Making in Deliberative Bodies
